texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Object of the Act
texts.text: Object of the Act

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 1. (1)  The  object  of  this  Act  is  to  provide  for  and  facilitate  electronic communications and related transactions in the public interest, and to
texts.text: 1. (1)  The  object  of  this  Act  is  to  provide  for  and  facilitate  electronic communications and related transactions in the public interest, and to

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) remove and prevent barriers to electronic communications and transactions;
texts.text: (a) remove and prevent barriers to electronic communications and transactions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) promote legal certainty and confidence in electronic communications and transactions;
texts.text: (b) promote legal certainty and confidence in electronic communications and transactions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) promote e-government services and electronic communications and transactions with public and private bodies, institutions and citizens;
texts.text: (c) promote e-government services and electronic communications and transactions with public and private bodies, institutions and citizens;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) develop a safe, secure and effective environment  for the consumer,  business  and  the  Government  to  conduct  and  use electronic transactions;
texts.text: (d) develop a safe, secure and effective environment  for the consumer,  business  and  the  Government  to  conduct  and  use electronic transactions;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (e) promote  the  development  of  electronic  transaction  services responsive to the needs of consumers;
texts.text: (e) promote  the  development  of  electronic  transaction  services responsive to the needs of consumers;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (f) ensure that, in relation to the provision of electronic transactions services, the special needs of vulnerable groups and communities and persons with disabilities are duly taken into account;
texts.text: (f) ensure that, in relation to the provision of electronic transactions services, the special needs of vulnerable groups and communities and persons with disabilities are duly taken into account;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (g) ensure compliance with accepted international technical standards in the provision and development  of electronic communications and transactions; and
texts.text: (g) ensure compliance with accepted international technical standards in the provision and development  of electronic communications and transactions; and

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (h) ensure  that  the  interest  and  image  of  the  Republic  are  not compromised through the use of electronic communications.
texts.text: (h) ensure  that  the  interest  and  image  of  the  Republic  are  not compromised through the use of electronic communications.

texts.orig: 2. This Act applies to electronic transactions and electronic records of every type.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 3. (1) This Act shall not be interpreted so as to exclude statutory law or the principles of the common law being applied to, recognising or accommodating electronic transactions, electronic records or any other matter provided for in this Act.
texts.text: 3. (1) This Act shall not be interpreted so as to exclude statutory law or the principles of the common law being applied to, recognising or accommodating electronic transactions, electronic records or any other matter provided for in this Act.

texts.text: (2) Unless otherwise provided, this Act shall not be construed as

texts.text: (a) requiring a person to generate, communicate, produce,  process, send, receive, record, retain, store or display information, document or signature by or in electronic form; or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "critical database" means a crucial set of data in an electronic record related to national security or the economic well-being of the public determined by the Minister;
texts.text: "critical database" means a crucial set of data in an electronic record related to national security or the economic well-being of the public determined by the Minister;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "critical database administrator" means the person responsible for the management and control of a critical database;
texts.text: "critical database administrator" means the person responsible for the management and control of a critical database;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "critical electronic record" means an electronic record, group or classification of electronic record which is declared by the Minister to be of importance to the protection of the national security of the Republic or the economic and social well-being of its citizens;
texts.text: "critical electronic record" means an electronic record, group or classification of electronic record which is declared by the Minister to be of importance to the protection of the national security of the Republic or the economic and social well-being of its citizens;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "cyber inspector" means a staff of the National Information Technology Agency with power to monitor, investigate, prosecute any offence under this Act and any other law enforcement agency acting under any provision of this Act;
texts.text: "cyber inspector" means a staff of the National Information Technology Agency with power to monitor, investigate, prosecute any offence under this Act and any other law enforcement agency acting under any provision of this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "damage " includes impairment to a computer or the integrity or availability of a programme or data held in a computer that:
texts.text: "damage " includes impairment to a computer or the integrity or availability of a programme or data held in a computer that:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) causes loss within the period prescribed under the Limitation Decree, 1972 (N.R.C.D. 54),
texts.text: (a) causes loss within the period prescribed under the Limitation Decree, 1972 (N.R.C.D. 54),

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) modifies or impairs, or potentially modifies or impairs, the medical examination, diagnosis, treatment or care of a person,
texts.text: (b) modifies or impairs, or potentially modifies or impairs, the medical examination, diagnosis, treatment or care of a person,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) causes or threatens physical injury or death to a person, or
texts.text: (c) causes or threatens physical injury or death to a person, or

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (d) threatens the public interest;
texts.text: (d) threatens the public interest;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "decryption information " means information or technology that enables a person to readily retransform or unscramble an encrypted programme or data from its unreadable and incomprehensible format to its plain text version;
texts.text: "decryption information " means information or technology that enables a person to readily retransform or unscramble an encrypted programme or data from its unreadable and incomprehensible format to its plain text version;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "device" means any thing or apparatus that is used or capable of being used to intercept a function of a computer or electronic record;
texts.text: "device" means any thing or apparatus that is used or capable of being used to intercept a function of a computer or electronic record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "digital platform" means an online-based system or interface, including webbased platforms and app-based ecosystems, that facilitates interaction between users for the exchange of goods, services, information, or content, including social media platforms, online marketplaces, and digital service aggregators;
texts.text: "digital platform" means an online-based system or interface, including webbased platforms and app-based ecosystems, that facilitates interaction between users for the exchange of goods, services, information, or content, including social media platforms, online marketplaces, and digital service aggregators;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "digital signature" means data attached to, incorporated in, or logically associated with other data and which is intended by the user to serve as a signature;
texts.text: "digital signature" means data attached to, incorporated in, or logically associated with other data and which is intended by the user to serve as a signature;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "domain name system " means a system to translate domain names into IP addresses or other information;
texts.text: "domain name system " means a system to translate domain names into IP addresses or other information;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: " E-Gazette" means an official Government publication issued in electronic format, which is accessible online, authenticated by electronic or digital signature, and which carries the same legal effect and admissibility in court as the print version of the Gazette;
texts.text: " E-Gazette" means an official Government publication issued in electronic format, which is accessible online, authenticated by electronic or digital signature, and which carries the same legal effect and admissibility in court as the print version of the Gazette;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "e-government services" means a public service provided by electronic means by a public body in the country;
texts.text: "e-government services" means a public service provided by electronic means by a public body in the country;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "e-mail " means electronic mail, an electronic record used or intended to be used as a mail message between the originator and addressee in an electronic communication;
texts.text: "e-mail " means electronic mail, an electronic record used or intended to be used as a mail message between the originator and addressee in an electronic communication;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "electronic agent" means a computer programme or an electronic or other automated means used independently to initiate an action or respond to electronic records or performances in whole or in part, in an automated transaction;
texts.text: "electronic agent" means a computer programme or an electronic or other automated means used independently to initiate an action or respond to electronic records or performances in whole or in part, in an automated transaction;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "electronic communication " means a communication by means of electronic records;
texts.text: "electronic communication " means a communication by means of electronic records;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "electronic payment medium" includes any medium issued to a holder capable of being used to make an electronic financial transaction;
texts.text: "electronic payment medium" includes any medium issued to a holder capable of being used to make an electronic financial transaction;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: "electronic record" includes data generated, sent, received or stored by electronic means:
texts.text: "electronic record" includes data generated, sent, received or stored by electronic means:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) voice, where voice is used in an automated transaction; and (b) a stored record;
texts.text: (a) voice, where voice is used in an automated transaction; and (b) a stored record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "electronic signature" means any data in electronic form, affixed to or logically associated with a data message, which is used by a person to indicate their agreement to the content of that data message or transaction, and which is capable of identifying the signatory and maintaining the integrity of the signed information;
texts.text: "electronic signature" means any data in electronic form, affixed to or logically associated with a data message, which is used by a person to indicate their agreement to the content of that data message or transaction, and which is capable of identifying the signatory and maintaining the integrity of the signed information;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "electronic transaction" means a transaction by an electronic agent;
texts.text: "electronic transaction" means a transaction by an electronic agent;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: "encrypted product" means a product that makes use of encryption techniques and is used by a sender or recipient of electronic record to ensure
texts.text: "encrypted product" means a product that makes use of encryption techniques and is used by a sender or recipient of electronic record to ensure

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) that the data can be accessed only by relevant persons,
texts.text: (a) that the data can be accessed only by relevant persons,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) the authenticity of the data,
texts.text: (b) the authenticity of the data,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the integrity of the data, or
texts.text: (c) the integrity of the data, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) that the source of the data can be correctly ascertained;
texts.text: (d) that the source of the data can be correctly ascertained;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "encrypted programme or electronic record" means a programme or data which has been transformed or scrambled from its plain text version to an unreadable or incomprehensible format, regardless of the technique utilized for the transformation or scrambling and irrespective of the medium in which the programme or data occurs or can be found for the purposes of protecting the content of the programme or data;
texts.text: "encrypted programme or electronic record" means a programme or data which has been transformed or scrambled from its plain text version to an unreadable or incomprehensible format, regardless of the technique utilized for the transformation or scrambling and irrespective of the medium in which the programme or data occurs or can be found for the purposes of protecting the content of the programme or data;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "encryption provider" means any person who provides or who proposes to provide encryption services or products in the country;
texts.text: "encryption provider" means any person who provides or who proposes to provide encryption services or products in the country;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "encryption service " means a service which is provided to a sender or a recipient of an electronic record or to anyone storing an electronic record, which is designed to facilitate the use of encryption techniques to ensure (a) that the data or electronic record can be accessed or can be put into an intelligible form only by certain persons,
texts.text: "encryption service " means a service which is provided to a sender or a recipient of an electronic record or to anyone storing an electronic record, which is designed to facilitate the use of encryption techniques to ensure (a) that the data or electronic record can be accessed or can be put into an intelligible form only by certain persons,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) that the authenticity or integrity of the data or electronic record is capable of being ascertained,
texts.text: (b) that the authenticity or integrity of the data or electronic record is capable of being ascertained,

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) the integrity of the data or electronic record, or
texts.text: (c) the integrity of the data or electronic record, or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (d) that the source of the data or electronic record can be correctly ascertained;
texts.text: (d) that the source of the data or electronic record can be correctly ascertained;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "essential emergency service" means a vital service to avoid the imminent occurrence of a situation which is out of the ordinary which threatens to endanger a person, public safety or cause damage to property;
texts.text: "essential emergency service" means a vital service to avoid the imminent occurrence of a situation which is out of the ordinary which threatens to endanger a person, public safety or cause damage to property;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "financial institution" means an entity that undertakes financial intermediation;
texts.text: "financial institution" means an entity that undertakes financial intermediation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "financial intermediation" means a process of transferring funds from one entity to another entity;
texts.text: "financial intermediation" means a process of transferring funds from one entity to another entity;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Forum" means Industry Forum;
texts.text: "Forum" means Industry Forum;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "function" includes logic, control, arithmetic, deletion, storage and retrieval, and communication or telecommunication to, from or within a computer;
texts.text: "function" includes logic, control, arithmetic, deletion, storage and retrieval, and communication or telecommunication to, from or within a computer;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Gazette" includes an electronic record of the Gazette and publication on the website of the appropriate Government Agency;
texts.text: "Gazette" includes an electronic record of the Gazette and publication on the website of the appropriate Government Agency;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: ".gh domain name space" means the .gh ccTLD assigned to the Republic according to the two-letter codes in the International Standard ISO 3166;
texts.text: ".gh domain name space" means the .gh ccTLD assigned to the Republic according to the two-letter codes in the International Standard ISO 3166;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Government" means any authority by which the executive authority of the Republic is duly exercised;
texts.text: "Government" means any authority by which the executive authority of the Republic is duly exercised;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "home page" means the primary entry point webpage of a website;
texts.text: "home page" means the primary entry point webpage of a website;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "hyperlink" means a reference or link from some point in one electronic record directing a browser or other technology or functionality to another electronic record or point in that electronic record or to another place in the same electronic record;
texts.text: "hyperlink" means a reference or link from some point in one electronic record directing a browser or other technology or functionality to another electronic record or point in that electronic record or to another place in the same electronic record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "hyper text" means a reference or link from some point in one electronic record directing a browser or other technology or functionality to another electronic record or point or to another place in the same electronic record;
texts.text: "hyper text" means a reference or link from some point in one electronic record directing a browser or other technology or functionality to another electronic record or point or to another place in the same electronic record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "incorporated body" means an entity registered under the Companies Act 2019 (Act 992), the Incorporated Private Partnerships Act 1962 (Act 152) or the Trustees Incorporation Act, 1962 (Act 106);
texts.text: "incorporated body" means an entity registered under the Companies Act 2019 (Act 992), the Incorporated Private Partnerships Act 1962 (Act 152) or the Trustees Incorporation Act, 1962 (Act 106);

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "incident response plan " means a formal set of procedures established by a licensed entity or certifying authority for detecting, reporting, responding to, and recovering from cybersecurity incidents or breaches that affect the integrity, availability, or confidentiality of its systems or services;
texts.text: "incident response plan " means a formal set of procedures established by a licensed entity or certifying authority for detecting, reporting, responding to, and recovering from cybersecurity incidents or breaches that affect the integrity, availability, or confidentiality of its systems or services;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "industry " means the communications industry;
texts.text: "industry " means the communications industry;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Industry Forum" means the communications industry meeting from time to time to discuss matters of common interest to and concerning the industry;
texts.text: "Industry Forum" means the communications industry meeting from time to time to discuss matters of common interest to and concerning the industry;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "information system" includes a system for generating, sending, receiving, storing, displaying or otherwise processing electronic records and the Internet;
texts.text: "information system" includes a system for generating, sending, receiving, storing, displaying or otherwise processing electronic records and the Internet;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "information system services" includes the provision of connections, the operation of facilities for information systems, the provision of access to information systems, the transmission or routing of electronic records between or among points specified by a user and the processing and storage of data at the individual request of the recipient of the service;
texts.text: "information system services" includes the provision of connections, the operation of facilities for information systems, the provision of access to information systems, the transmission or routing of electronic records between or among points specified by a user and the processing and storage of data at the individual request of the recipient of the service;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "intercept" includes, in relation to a function of a computer or electronic record, listening to or recording a function of a computer or electronic record, or acquiring the substance, meaning or purport of it;
texts.text: "intercept" includes, in relation to a function of a computer or electronic record, listening to or recording a function of a computer or electronic record, or acquiring the substance, meaning or purport of it;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "intermediary" means a person who, on behalf of another person, whether as agent or not, sends, receives or stores a particular electronic record or provides other services with respect to that electronic record;
texts.text: "intermediary" means a person who, on behalf of another person, whether as agent or not, sends, receives or stores a particular electronic record or provides other services with respect to that electronic record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "interoperability standards " means technical specifications that ensure digital systems, applications, and processes are capable of exchanging and using information securely, effectively, and consistently across different platforms, jurisdictions, or certifying authorities;
texts.text: "interoperability standards " means technical specifications that ensure digital systems, applications, and processes are capable of exchanging and using information securely, effectively, and consistently across different platforms, jurisdictions, or certifying authorities;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Internet" means the interconnected system of networks that connects computers around the world using the TCP/IP and future versions of the interconnected system;
texts.text: "Internet" means the interconnected system of networks that connects computers around the world using the TCP/IP and future versions of the interconnected system;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "IP address" means the number identifying the point of connection of a computer or other device to the internet;
texts.text: "IP address" means the number identifying the point of connection of a computer or other device to the internet;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "law enforcement agency" means the police, customs, excise and preventive service and any other law enforcement agency authorised by law to exercise police powers;
texts.text: "law enforcement agency" means the police, customs, excise and preventive service and any other law enforcement agency authorised by law to exercise police powers;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Minister" means the Minister responsible for Communications;
texts.text: "Minister" means the Minister responsible for Communications;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Ministry" means the Ministry responsible for Communications;
texts.text: "Ministry" means the Ministry responsible for Communications;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "notice" means transactional message or notification intended to elicit the subscriber's choice to opt-in or opt-out of a service, or an emergency communication prescribed by law;
texts.text: "notice" means transactional message or notification intended to elicit the subscriber's choice to opt-in or opt-out of a service, or an emergency communication prescribed by law;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "originator" means a person by whom, or on whose behalf, an electronic record purports to have been sent or generated prior to storage, but does not mean a person acting as an intermediary with respect to that electronic record;
texts.text: "originator" means a person by whom, or on whose behalf, an electronic record purports to have been sent or generated prior to storage, but does not mean a person acting as an intermediary with respect to that electronic record;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "person " includes a public agency;
texts.text: "person " includes a public agency;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "personal information " means information about an identifiable individual, including, but not limited to: (a) information relating to the race, gender, sex, pregnancy, marital status, nationality, ethnic or social origin, colour, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental health, well-being; disability, religion, conscience, belief, culture, language and birth of the individual; (b) information relating to the education or the medical, criminal or employment history of the individual or information relating to financial transactions in which the individual has been involved; (c) any identifying number, symbol, or other particular assigned to the individual; (d) the address, fingerprints or blood type of the individual; (e) the personal opinions, views or preferences of the individual, except where they are about another individual or about a proposal for a grant, an award or a prize to be made to another individual; (f) correspondence sent by the individual that is implicitly or explicitly of a private or confidential nature or further correspondence that would reveal the contents of original correspondence; (g) the views or opinions of another individual about the individual; (h) the views or opinions of another individual about a proposal for a grant, an award or a prize to be made to the individual, but excluding the name of the other individual where it appears with the views or opinions of the other individual; and (i) the name of the individual where it appears with other personal information relating to the individual or where the disclosure of the name itself would reveal information about the individual, but excludes information about an individual who has been dead for more than twenty years;
texts.text: "personal information " means information about an identifiable individual, including, but not limited to: (a) information relating to the race, gender, sex, pregnancy, marital status, nationality, ethnic or social origin, colour, sexual orientation, age, physical or mental health, well-being; disability, religion, conscience, belief, culture, language and birth of the individual; (b) information relating to the education or the medical, criminal or employment history of the individual or information relating to financial transactions in which the individual has been involved; (c) any identifying number, symbol, or other particular assigned to the individual; (d) the address, fingerprints or blood type of the individual; (e) the personal opinions, views or preferences of the individual, except where they are about another individual or about a proposal for a grant, an award or a prize to be made to another individual; (f) correspondence sent by the individual that is implicitly or explicitly of a private or confidential nature or further correspondence that would reveal the contents of original correspondence; (g) the views or opinions of another individual about the individual; (h) the views or opinions of another individual about a proposal for a grant, an award or a prize to be made to the individual, but excluding the name of the other individual where it appears with the views or opinions of the other individual; and (i) the name of the individual where it appears with other personal information relating to the individual or where the disclosure of the name itself would reveal information about the individual, but excludes information about an individual who has been dead for more than twenty years;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "plain text version" means a programme or original data before it has been transformed or scrambled to an unreadable or incomprehensible format;
texts.text: "plain text version" means a programme or original data before it has been transformed or scrambled to an unreadable or incomprehensible format;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "prescribe" means prescribe by directive, notice or Regulation under this Act;
texts.text: "prescribe" means prescribe by directive, notice or Regulation under this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "programme or computer programme" means data representing instructions or statements which when executed in a computer, causes the computer to perform a function;
texts.text: "programme or computer programme" means data representing instructions or statements which when executed in a computer, causes the computer to perform a function;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "programme or data" includes a reference to a programme or data held in any removable storage medium which is for the time being in the computer;
texts.text: "programme or data" includes a reference to a programme or data held in any removable storage medium which is for the time being in the computer;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public agency" means a body set-up by Government in the public interest with or without an Act of Parliament;
texts.text: "public agency" means a body set-up by Government in the public interest with or without an Act of Parliament;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) department of central government or a department in local government; or (b) any other functionary or institution when
texts.text: (a) department of central government or a department in local government; or (b) any other functionary or institution when

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (i) exercising a power or discharging a duty in terms of the Constitution; or
texts.text: (i) exercising a power or discharging a duty in terms of the Constitution; or

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (ii) exercising a power or performing a function in terms of any legislation;
texts.text: (ii) exercising a power or performing a function in terms of any legislation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public interest" includes a right or advantage which enures or is intended to enure to the general benefit of the people of this country, including but not limited to access to essential digital services, protection of personal data, promotion of cybersecurity, and the safeguarding of national digital infrastructure;
texts.text: "public interest" includes a right or advantage which enures or is intended to enure to the general benefit of the people of this country, including but not limited to access to essential digital services, protection of personal data, promotion of cybersecurity, and the safeguarding of national digital infrastructure;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "public key" means the key which is available to the public for purposes of the encryption of an electronic key which is linked to a private decryption key held exclusively by the issuer of the key available to the public;
texts.text: "public key" means the key which is available to the public for purposes of the encryption of an electronic key which is linked to a private decryption key held exclusively by the issuer of the key available to the public;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Public Key Infrastructure" (PKI) means a system of policies, roles, hardware, software, and procedures needed to create, manage, distribute, use, store, and revoke digital certificates and public keys, enabling secure electronic transactions and communication through authentication, confidentiality, integrity, and non-repudiation;
texts.text: "Public Key Infrastructure" (PKI) means a system of policies, roles, hardware, software, and procedures needed to create, manage, distribute, use, store, and revoke digital certificates and public keys, enabling secure electronic transactions and communication through authentication, confidentiality, integrity, and non-repudiation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Qualified Electronic Signature" means an electronic signature that-
texts.text: "Qualified Electronic Signature" means an electronic signature that-

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (a) is uniquely linked to the signatory;
texts.text: (a) is uniquely linked to the signatory;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (b) is capable of identifying the signatory;
texts.text: (b) is capable of identifying the signatory;

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: (c) is created using means that the signatory can maintain under their sole control; and
texts.text: (c) is created using means that the signatory can maintain under their sole control; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (d) is based on a qualified certificate issued by a certification service provider accredited or recognised under this Act;
texts.text: (d) is based on a qualified certificate issued by a certification service provider accredited or recognised under this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "recommendation system" means an automated system used by an online platform to suggest content, products, services, or interactions to users based on data collected from or about those users or other users;
texts.text: "recommendation system" means an automated system used by an online platform to suggest content, products, services, or interactions to users based on data collected from or about those users or other users;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "repository" means the primary register of electronic records or information maintained by a registry or certification service provider, for the purpose of storing, publishing, or retrieving digital certificates, public keys, or related transactional data;
texts.text: "repository" means the primary register of electronic records or information maintained by a registry or certification service provider, for the purpose of storing, publishing, or retrieving digital certificates, public keys, or related transactional data;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "risk management practices" means structured processes, tools, and procedures employed to assess, monitor, and address operational, technological, legal, and reputational risks within an electronic communication environment;
texts.text: "risk management practices" means structured processes, tools, and procedures employed to assess, monitor, and address operational, technological, legal, and reputational risks within an electronic communication environment;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "risk mitigation plan " means a documented strategy developed by a service provider or platform to identify, reduce, and manage potential systemic risks and vulnerabilities associated with its operations, systems, or content dissemination processes;
texts.text: "risk mitigation plan " means a documented strategy developed by a service provider or platform to identify, reduce, and manage potential systemic risks and vulnerabilities associated with its operations, systems, or content dissemination processes;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Root CA" means the Root Certification Authority, being the top-level trusted entity in a Public Key Infrastructure that issues and digitally signs certificates for subordinate certification authorities, and serves as the foundational trust anchor for the validation of all digital certificates issued under the infrastructure;
texts.text: "Root CA" means the Root Certification Authority, being the top-level trusted entity in a Public Key Infrastructure that issues and digitally signs certificates for subordinate certification authorities, and serves as the foundational trust anchor for the validation of all digital certificates issued under the infrastructure;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "second level domain" means the sub domain immediately following the ccTLD;
texts.text: "second level domain" means the sub domain immediately following the ccTLD;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "security agency" means a body connected with national security;
texts.text: "security agency" means a body connected with national security;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "service provider" means any person providing information system services;
texts.text: "service provider" means any person providing information system services;

texts.label: footnote
texts.orig: "statutory provision " means by or under an Act of Parliament;
texts.text: "statutory provision " means by or under an Act of Parliament;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "sub domain" means any subdivision of the .gh domain name space which is the second level domain;
texts.text: "sub domain" means any subdivision of the .gh domain name space which is the second level domain;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Subscriber" means a person or entity that is the subject named or identified in a digital certificate, who has applied for and been issued the certificate by a certification service provider, and who holds the corresponding private key associated with the public key listed in the certificate;
texts.text: "Subscriber" means a person or entity that is the subject named or identified in a digital certificate, who has applied for and been issued the certificate by a certification service provider, and who holds the corresponding private key associated with the public key listed in the certificate;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "TCP/IP" means the Transmission Control Protocol Internet Protocol used by an information system to connect to the Internet;
texts.text: "TCP/IP" means the Transmission Control Protocol Internet Protocol used by an information system to connect to the Internet;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "TI-D" means a top level domain of the domain name system;
texts.text: "TI-D" means a top level domain of the domain name system;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "third party" in relation to a service provider, means a subscriber to the service provider's services or any other user of the service provider's services or a user of information systems;
texts.text: "third party" in relation to a service provider, means a subscriber to the service provider's services or any other user of the service provider's services or a user of information systems;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "transaction" means a transaction of either a commercial or non-commercial nature and the provision of information and e-government services;
texts.text: "transaction" means a transaction of either a commercial or non-commercial nature and the provision of information and e-government services;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "transparency report" means a periodic report published by a service provider, certifying authority, or platform detailing the scope and nature of content moderation activities, use of automated tools, algorithmic processes, complaints received and resolved, and other operational metrics as required under this Act;
texts.text: "transparency report" means a periodic report published by a service provider, certifying authority, or platform detailing the scope and nature of content moderation activities, use of automated tools, algorithmic processes, complaints received and resolved, and other operational metrics as required under this Act;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "unauthorised access " is access of any kind by a person to a programme or data held in a computer without authority if:
texts.text: "unauthorised access " is access of any kind by a person to a programme or data held in a computer without authority if:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (a) the person is not personally entitled to control access of the kind in question to the programme or data; and
texts.text: (a) the person is not personally entitled to control access of the kind in question to the programme or data; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (b) the person does not have consent to access the kind of programme or data from the person who is entitled to control access;
texts.text: (b) the person does not have consent to access the kind of programme or data from the person who is entitled to control access;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "unincorporated body" means an entity registered under the Registration of Business Names Act, 1962 (Act 151) or any person carrying on business without a registration or without a certificate of incorporation;
texts.text: "unincorporated body" means an entity registered under the Registration of Business Names Act, 1962 (Act 151) or any person carrying on business without a registration or without a certificate of incorporation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "universal access" means access by all citizens of Ghana to internet connectivity and electronic transactions;
texts.text: "universal access" means access by all citizens of Ghana to internet connectivity and electronic transactions;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "user-generated content" means any form of content, including text, images, videos, or audio, created and uploaded by a user of an online platform, which is not pre-selected or controlled by the service provider other than through moderation or algorithmic curation;
texts.text: "user-generated content" means any form of content, including text, images, videos, or audio, created and uploaded by a user of an online platform, which is not pre-selected or controlled by the service provider other than through moderation or algorithmic curation;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Very Large Online Platforms" or "VLOPs" means online platforms that provide intermediary services primarily consisting of hosting user-generated content, which reach an average of forty-five million or more monthly active users within the jurisdiction or relevant region, and which, due to their size, have a significant societal or systemic impact on the dissemination of information, public discourse, or access to goods and services online;
texts.text: "Very Large Online Platforms" or "VLOPs" means online platforms that provide intermediary services primarily consisting of hosting user-generated content, which reach an average of forty-five million or more monthly active users within the jurisdiction or relevant region, and which, due to their size, have a significant societal or systemic impact on the dissemination of information, public discourse, or access to goods and services online;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "Very Large Online Search Engines" or "VLOSEs" means online search engines that allow users to input queries to retrieve information from websites across the internet, and which reach an average of forty-five million or more monthly active users, thereby having a considerable effect on the visibility of online information and the flow of digital traffic;
texts.text: "Very Large Online Search Engines" or "VLOSEs" means online search engines that allow users to input queries to retrieve information from websites across the internet, and which reach an average of forty-five million or more monthly active users, thereby having a considerable effect on the visibility of online information and the flow of digital traffic;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "webpage" means an electronic record on the World Wide Web;
texts.text: "webpage" means an electronic record on the World Wide Web;

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "website" means a location on the Internet containing a home page or web page; and
texts.text: "website" means a location on the Internet containing a home page or web page; and

texts.label: text
texts.orig: "World Wide Web" means an information browsing framework that allows a user to locate and access information stored on a remote computer and to follow references from one computer to related information on another computer.
texts.text: "World Wide Web" means an information browsing framework that allows a user to locate and access information stored on a remote computer and to follow references from one computer to related information on another computer.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 86 . (1) The Electronic Transactions Act, 2008 (Act 772) is hereby repealed. (2) Despite the repeal under subsection (1), any licence, authorisation, notice, or other lawful act issued or done under the repealed enactment, and in force immediately before the coming into force of this Act, shall, to the extent that it is not inconsistent with this Act, be deemed to have been issued or done under
texts.text: 86 . (1) The Electronic Transactions Act, 2008 (Act 772) is hereby repealed. (2) Despite the repeal under subsection (1), any licence, authorisation, notice, or other lawful act issued or done under the repealed enactment, and in force immediately before the coming into force of this Act, shall, to the extent that it is not inconsistent with this Act, be deemed to have been issued or done under

texts.label: text
texts.orig: this Act  and  shall  continue  in  force  until  it  is  revoked,  reviewed,  cancelled, terminated, or expires.
texts.text: this Act  and  shall  continue  in  force  until  it  is  revoked,  reviewed,  cancelled, terminated, or expires.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (3) The Act shall not affect the repealed enactment in the operation of offences committed, penalties imposed or proceedings commenced before the coming into force of this Act.
texts.text: (3) The Act shall not affect the repealed enactment in the operation of offences committed, penalties imposed or proceedings commenced before the coming into force of this Act.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Modification of existing enactments
texts.text: Modification of existing enactments

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 87. (1)  The provisions of any enactment relevant to this Act and in existence before  the  coming  into  force  of  this  Act  shall  have  effect  subject  to  such modifications necessary to give effect to this Act.
texts.text: 87. (1)  The provisions of any enactment relevant to this Act and in existence before  the  coming  into  force  of  this  Act  shall  have  effect  subject  to  such modifications necessary to give effect to this Act.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: (2) Where there is a conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Act and any other enactment relevant to this Act, the provisions of this Act shall prevail.
texts.text: (2) Where there is a conflict or inconsistency between the provisions of this Act and any other enactment relevant to this Act, the provisions of this Act shall prevail.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Transitional Provisions
texts.text: Transitional Provisions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 88 .  (1) A  licence, frequency  authorisation, permit or certificate issued by the National Communications Authority in respect of electronic communications, spectrum,  or  broadcasting  services  shall  remain  valid  until  it  is  revoked, cancelled, terminated by the Authority, or expires in accordance with its terms. (2)  Licensees  and  entities  subject  to  new  obligations  under  this Act  shall  be given a period of twelve months from the commencement of this Act, or such longer period as may be prescribed by the Minister, to bring their operations into full compliance.
texts.text: 88 .  (1) A  licence, frequency  authorisation, permit or certificate issued by the National Communications Authority in respect of electronic communications, spectrum,  or  broadcasting  services  shall  remain  valid  until  it  is  revoked, cancelled, terminated by the Authority, or expires in accordance with its terms. (2)  Licensees  and  entities  subject  to  new  obligations  under  this Act  shall  be given a period of twelve months from the commencement of this Act, or such longer period as may be prescribed by the Minister, to bring their operations into full compliance.
